DataElement.preferredName: MRI Gadolinium Manual Injection Rate Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: If gadolinium was manually injected, provide the Injection rate.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The use of a syringe and needle to administer Gadolinium by hand used in an image that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Property.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25.:Of or related to the hands; reference to a task or activity being done by hand (as opposed as being performed with the assistance of automation or other supportive means).:Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot."

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Gd, atomic number 64, and atomic weight 157.25.
Of or related to the hands; reference to a task or activity being done by hand (as opposed as being performed with the assistance of automation or other supportive means).
Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/13/09 Released to support C3D Adopter reuse request.  3/13/08 created for ACRIN Breast DCE/MRI 6676-M3 & 6676-M4.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity which expresses the measurement of speed relative to time that fluids or drugs are push into the body with the use of a syringe and needle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot.":A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time. (NCI):A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.
A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
